Message.Title: Yahoo Says it Won’t Part With Ad Technology
Message.Msg: Wouldn’t it make more sense for the struggling company to just sell or outsource what it has? The answer from recently-installed Yahoo CEO Marissa Mayer has been a clear no, according to company executives. “We see it as a core element to being a successful, global Internet company,” Michael Barrett, Yahoo’s chief revenue officer, said of the advertising technology. “It’s not coincidental that Marissa’s a big fan of ad technology, she worked on it herself at Google for many years,” he added. Barrett said keeping Yahoo’s advertising technology in-house will enable it to be “more facile” as buying patterns among advertisers change.

Topic.Title: All of YHOO FINANCE screwed up

Message.Msg: It didn't quite kill off all the spammers, only the external ones posting URLs. There are still internal spammers reposting their msgs via cut and paste on various boards. E.g., check out all the DuPont (DD) related msgs by funfundvierzig reposted on the boards for DOW, HUN, PPG, SHW, SMG, SYT... The problems are compounded by the "new and improved" (NOT!) "Report Abuse" option. Now it no longer lets you ID the type of abuse or send a written comment to the webmaster. (Maybe Yahoo! really doesn't want to hear complaints or feedback?) Blocking posts with embedded URLs may have stopped external spammers, but it also makes it harder to post a link to anything that is of real potential interest to board readers regarding the company.

Message.Msg: Yes YHOO is a dinosaur, a baby Tyrannosaurus Rex! I just spoke with YHOO corp investor relations and they advised me that share repurchases were nonpublic information and they had no comment on the subject. I called to see if they were as stupid as you indicated they were! They were not stupid! So Michan59 if you will provide me , the board, the name of the person addressing your inquiry, we will get to the bottom of the matter. If you fail to respond, we can safely assume your a total fraud, and likely short YHOO. I was advised that the share repurchase information would be made available in conjunction with the quarterly reporting. Give us a name! I want blood! Yours or anyones. I have been in the markets for over 50 years and fully understand share repurchases and corporate responsibility. What you posted was totally contrary to any responsible corporate action. Remember YHOO has your IP address and if your not working for Loeb and trying to pass disinformation, your very likely claiming insider information and disclosing it, in either case, I can rely on a complaint to the SEC to resolve the matter. I have posted that YHOO was buying stock based on public information of order flow and buyers representative, I will stand behind my posts that YHOO will have bought in close to 200 million shares when they release their report in mid Oct. And they will still have plenty of cash to buy Path and Yelp, if they so desire, which I hope they do attempt.

Topic.Title: "IF IT A'INT BROKE, FIX IT"

Message.Msg: Another yahoo motto. While getting rid of spammers, yahoo finance lost much of its user base. Are they too proud to admit they screwed up and bring back the old m.b. format?

Topic.Title: "IF IT A'INT BROKE, FIX IT"

Message.Msg: It is a learning curve, once you take the time to figure out how to navigate the new format, it flows smoothly and is as effective as the old board format. Any users who jumped ship will return, it is the only game of its kind in town. Now we have limited spammers by eliminating their easy access to one board after another from a single screen. I like the new format. Experiment with it and you will gain confidence in it.

Message.Title: dividens
Message.Msg: i want to think about dividends s since its such a big factor in valuing this stock. i know i know already a simple yield analyisis just one of many ways to look at valuation never the less its still a reasonable measure and means to est future price performance. a yield history of sfl looks like this . since we are now at high for the year i used the high for past years 07=6.7% 08=6.7% 09=8.2%10=5.8%11=6.812=8.4 ave=7.1% if we use 1.56 div for next year then we get a target price of 22=7.1% thats up side of 27% plus yield add back of another 9%or so . go ahead and speculate we get 10%bump next year a7.1%yield on 1.72=24 or about 38% up side +yield add back i keep checking the box strong buy ! new format plus poor typing skills =double trouble for me just some food for thought jim

Message.Title: Flickr will dominate Instagram
Message.Msg: Mayer’s already visited with the Flickr team once in their San Francisco headquarters. Sure, it’s been left to die on the vine even though it was once the dominant photo sharing service. But it’s still a great service that can be returned to even rival Instagram. And the best part of it? Yahoo! spent $60 million for it 7 years ago instead of a billion! I expect she’s given the Flickr team its marching orders already: “Be the dominant photo sharing service again in a year! I don’t care what it takes. Just do it. The Instagram guys have 13 people and haven’t innovated in their product for 18 months. It’s just a bunch of cutesy filters and out-of-focus features that you can easily tweet. We can replicate that in 60 days and then out-innovate the hell out of them in the 60 days after that.” And watch for iOS PhotoStream integration here folks. Keep it Dead Simple, Stupid!
